checkersMain
Interface CheckersPlayerInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
BadCheckersPlayer, BasicAI, CheckerKnight, ChinookJr, EFCheckersPlayer, HAL1000, HAL1000S, HAL900, HAL900S, Human, NaqshAndKarenAI, RandomAI
public interface CheckersPlayerInterface

This is a basic interface that every checkers player should implement. It is used by the CheckersGameManager to simulate a game of Checkers between checkers players.

Note: The CheckersPlayerInterface should have a constructor with no parameters.

Version:
1.20 - 3 August 2008
Author:
Jeremy Hoffman (v1.00), Amos Yuen

Nested Class Summary
static class CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent
          A wrapper class that contains information the CheckersPlayerInterface needs without giving the CheckersPlayerInterface access to the CheckersGameManager .

Method Detail

choosePlyIndex

int choosePlyIndex(CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent cpe)
Returns the ply index of this CheckersPlayerInterface's choice that corresponds to the CheckersBoard and CheckersBoard.Ply returned from the methods CheckersBoard.getSuccessor(int) or CheckersBoard.getPly(int) respectively.

This CheckersPlayerInterface should assume that the current player is Player1, it is this CheckersPlayerInterface turn, and that Player1's checkers and kings move from the bottom-to-top.

Note: If this returns an index value outside the range from zero to CheckersBoard.getNumSuccessors(), the CheckersGameManager will choose a move at random.)

Parameters:
cpe - - the CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent event
Returns:
the index this CheckersPlayerInterface chooses to take
See Also:
CheckersBoard.getPly(int), CheckersBoard.getSuccessor(int), CheckersBoard.getNumPlies(), CheckersBoard.getNumSuccessors(), CheckersBoard.Ply

gameEnded

void gameEnded(CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent cpe)
Notifies the CheckersPlayerInterface that the checkers game has ended.

Parameters:
cpe - - the CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent event
See Also:
CheckersGameManager.GAME_IN_PROGRESS, CheckersGameManager.INTERRUPTED, CheckersGameManager.DRAW, CheckersGameManager.PLAYER1_WINS, CheckersGameManager.PLAYER2_WINS

gameStarted

void gameStarted(CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent cpe)
Notifies CheckersPlayerInterface that it is beginning a new game. It is meant for AI's that need to set certain variables at the start of a game.

Parameters:
cpe - - the CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent event

getDescription

java.lang.String getDescription()
Returns a description of this CheckersPlayerInterface. The text should be displayed in a JTextArea using line wrap.

Returns:
a description of this CheckersPlayerInterface

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the display name of this CheckersPlayerInterface.

Returns:
the display name of this CheckersPlayerInterface

remainingTimeChanged

void remainingTimeChanged(CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent cpe)
Notifies this CheckersPlayerInterface on how much time is remaining for its choosePlyIndex(CheckersPlayerEvent) method to run.

This method will be called constantly by the CheckersGameManager, so the remaining time should probably be stored, and allow the choosePlyIndex(CheckersPlayerEvent) method to check the remaining time to determine future actions.

Parameters:
cpe - - the CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent event
